item.title: #es @ 1477813590107295758
item.description: En los datos abiertos, ~18% de los resultados negativos por antÃ­geno (a la fecha) resultaron ser positivos cuando se repitiÃ³ la prueba por PCR. Si te haces prueba de antÃ­geno, mejor aÃ­slate y repite la prueba unos dÃ­as despuÃ©s, por tu bien y el de tus contactos. https://t.co/p8W3UA839s

item.title: #es @ 1477813586605056000
item.description: Los datos abiertos COVID-19 de MÃ©xico contienen muchos pacientes a los que se ha hecho tanto prueba PCR como prueba antÃ­geno. Cuando una prueba de antÃ­geno da resultado positivo, es muy poco probable que se trate de un error; si sale negativo, tÃ³malo con cautela.

item.title: #en @ 1477811835030028288
item.description:
SMH at people rushing from Twitter to another centralized service, again. AWS, CDN, and other providers will just kill it if needed.
The only censorship resistant platforms are decentralized, open data ones like @desoprotocol and @joinmastodon.
When will we finally learn?

item.title: #en @ 1477789271058616320
item.description:
YR is a great example of why the NZ Government has got it *so* wrong with Niwa.
NZ model: Tax payers own 2 commercial Govt forecasters, severely limiting access to public data.
Norway Model: Tax payers fund 1 Govt forecaster who provides open data so useful people in NZ use it. https://t.co/GwL8M6My9q

item.description:

Finally, open data boosts public trust, which is critical in a public health crisis.

item.title: #en @ 1477066300656607234
item.description:
I should add - this was a challenging year - but it has illustrated the immense power we have to hold govt to account. From open data on schools; to tracking the epidemic; to those who advocated for govt to do better, here and in media - you've all made a difference.
Thank you.
